titles: Die Veneris 5‚Å∞. Maij. 1643. It is this day ordered by the Lords and Commons in Parliament, that the booke concerning the enjoyning and tollerating of sports upon the Lords day, be forthwith burned ...
author: England and Wales. Parliament.
publisher: Printed for Thomas Underhill in Great Woodstreete,
notes: Title from caption and first lines of text.
An ordinance for burning a book of sports by the hand of the common hangman.
Order signed: John Browne Cler Parl. and Henry Elsynge Cler. P. D. Com.; agreement to order signed: Iohn Langham, Thomas Andrewes.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Book burning --  England --  Early works to 1800.
